member.name: IKnownFolderManager.FindFolderFromIDList
member.summary: Gets an object that represents a known folder based on an IDList. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .
member.param: A pointer to the IDList.
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.FindFolderFromPath
member.summary: Gets an object that represents a known folder based on a file system path. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string of length MAX_PATH that contains a path to a known folder.

param.name: mode
param.para: One of the following values that specify the precision of the match of path and known folder:
Retrieve only the specific known folder for the given file path.
If an exact match is not found for the given file path, retrieve the first known folder that matches one of its parent folders walking up the parent tree.

member.param: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.FolderIdFromCsidl
member.summary: Gets the KNOWNFOLDERID that is the equivalent of a legacy CSIDL value.
member.param: The CSIDL value.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the KNOWNFOLDERID. This pointer is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.FolderIdToCsidl
member.summary: Gets the legacy CSIDL value that is the equivalent of a given KNOWNFOLDERID.
member.param: Reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the CSIDL value. This pointer is passed uninitialized.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

listheader.description: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.GetFolder
member.summary: Gets an object that represents a known folder identified by its KNOWNFOLDERID. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .
member.param: Reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID.
When this method returns, contains an interface pointer to the object that represents the folder.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

listheader.description: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.GetFolderByName
member.summary: Gets an object that represents a known folder identified by its canonical name. The object allows you to query certain folder properties, get the current path of the folder, redirect the folder to another location, and get the path of the folder as an .
member.param: A pointer to the non-localized, canonical name for the known folder, stored as a null-terminated Unicode string. If this folder is a or folder, this value is also used as the value name of the "User Shell Folders" registry settings. This value is retrieved through the pszName member of the folder's structure.
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the object that represents the known folder.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.GetFolderIds
member.summary: Gets an array of all registered known folder IDs. This can be used in enumerating all known folders.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of all KNOWNFOLDERID values registered with the system. Use to free these resources when they are no longer needed.
When this method returns, contains a pointer to the number of KNOWNFOLDERID values in the array at ppKFId. The [in] functionality of this parameter is not used.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.Redirect
member.summary: Redirects folder requests for common and per-user folders.
member.param: A reference to the KNOWNFOLDERID of the folder to be redirected.
The handle of the parent window used to display copy engine progress UI dialogs when is passed in the flags parameter. If no progress dialog is needed, this value can be NULL.
The options for redirection.
A pointer to the new path for the folder. This is a null-terminated Unicode string. This value can be NULL.
The number of KNOWNFOLDERID values in the array at pExclusion.
Pointer to an array of KNOWNFOLDERID values that refer to subfolders of rfid that should be excluded from the redirection. If no subfolders are excluded, this value can be NULL.
When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string that contains an error message if one was generated. This value can be NULL.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

listheader.description: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values for the current system.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.RegisterFolder
member.summary: Adds a new known folder to the registry. Used particularly by independent software vendors (ISVs) that are adding one of their own folders to the known folder system.
member.param: A GUID that represents the known folder.
A pointer to a valid structure that provides the details of the new folder.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager.UnregisterFolder
member.summary: Remove a known folder from the registry, which makes it unknown to the known folder system. This method does not remove the folder itself.
member.param: GUID or KNOWNFOLDERID that represents the known folder.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

listheader.description: Among other things, this value can indicate that the rfid parameter references a KNOWNFOLDERID that is not present on the system. Not all KNOWNFOLDERID values are present on all systems. Use to retrieve the set of KNOWNFOLDERID values known to the current system.

member.name: IKnownFolderManager
member.summary: Exposes methods that create, enumerate or manage existing known folders.
